messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.

You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 4
Name: April May
Description: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Bellboy
Description: Bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel.
Character 7
Name: Redd White
Description: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: The Thinker
Description: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz. Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.
Evidence 2
Name: Glass Shards
Description: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.
Evidence 3
Name: Receipt
Description: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back. Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Maya's Memo
Description: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."
Evidence 5
Name: Mia's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous. Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.
Evidence 6
Name: Maya's Cell Phone
Description: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.
Evidence 7
Name: Wiretap
Description: Found in Miss May's hotel room.
Evidence 8
Name: Floor Plans
Description: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: May Testimony
Description: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."
Evidence 10
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph
Description: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.
Evidence 12
Name: Bellboy's Affidavit
Description: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.
Evidence 13
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.
Evidence 14
Name: Mia's Memo
Description: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: After securing the suspect, I examined the scene of the crime with my own eyes.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: I found a memo written on a piece of paper next to the victim's body!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: On it, the word "Maya" was written clearly in blood!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: Lab test results showed that the blood was the victim's!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: Also, there was blood found on the victim's finger!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: Before she died, the victim wrote the killer's name!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
You are a helpful assistant.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I did see everything! I did!
Person: April
Testimony 1
Testimony: The victim--the woman--dodged the first attack and ran off to the right.
Person: April
Testimony 2
Testimony: Then the girl in the hippie clothes ran after her...
Person: April
Testimony 3
Testimony: And she hit her with that weapon! I saw it! I did!
Person: April
Testimony 4
Testimony: That... that clock! Um... the kinda statue-y clock? "The Thinker," I think?
Person: April

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Let's see, it was about 9:00, I believe.
Person: White
Testimony 1
Testimony: I was quietly perusifying... er, that's "reading" to you, some papers by the window.
Person: White
Testimony 2
Testimony: Then I heard a bedlam coming from outside!
Person: White
Testimony 3
Testimony: Surprised, I turned to look at the building across the way.
Person: White
Testimony 4
Testimony: It was then I saw him: a spiky-haired man attacking a woman with long hair!
Person: White
Testimony 5
Testimony: Needless to say that man was none other than you, Mr. Lawyer!
Person: White
Testimony 6
Testimony: I called Miss May over at once. She, too, was surprised of course.
Person: White
Testimony 7
Testimony: The victim, she... she ran away, but you gave chase!
Person: White
Testimony 8
Testimony: The victim ran to the left, and you gave chase!
Person: White
Testimony 9
Testimony: Finally there was a terrible impaction! Then it was all over...
Person: White

Testimony 0
Testimony: Miss May's testimony was correct... as was mine!
Person: White
Testimony 1
Testimony: When you assaulted the girl, she first ran to the left.
Person: White
Testimony 2
Testimony: And then you hit her, savagely! That is what I saw.
Person: White
Testimony 3
Testimony: Next, with the last of her strength, she ran to the right.
Person: White
Testimony 4
Testimony: You chased her, and delivered the final blow.
Person: White
Testimony 5
Testimony: That is what Miss May saw.
Person: White
Testimony 6
Testimony: You see? You hit her twice!
Person: White

Testimony 0
Testimony: Umm, well, see--I looked at the other window when I heard that thing fall.
Person: White
Testimony 1
Testimony: A light stand was lying on the floor when I looked.
Person: White
Testimony 2
Testimony: Then, the next moment, I saw Miss Mia run to the left!
Person: White
Testimony 3
Testimony: The killer, you, attacked her... but she dodged.
Person: White
Testimony 4
Testimony: She turned, and ran for the door!
Person: White
Testimony 5
Testimony: Then you did her in with a single blow! Thwap!
Person: White

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Will:
No, it's okay. This is the real me. When I got the part of the Steel Samurai, with that mask...
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.

Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.

Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen

Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...?

Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. [info] This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...?

Character 5
Name: Russell Berry
Description: The victim and Ringmaster of the Berry Big Circus. Regina Berry's father.
Character 6
Name: Ben
Description: Real Name: Benjamin Woodman. A ventriloquist. Conversing with him is really tiring.
Character 7
Name: Moe
Description: Real Name: Lawrence Curls. The Ringmaster's old friend, a pleasant stooge of a clown.
Character 8
Name: Acro
Description: Real Name: Ken Dingling. A star acrobat currently undergoing rehabilitation.

Evidence 7
Name: Broken Bottle
Description: An orange juice bottle that was found broken on the cafeteria floor.
Evidence 8
Name: Trilo Quist
Description: A ventriloquist's puppet. An operatic tenor who doubles as Ben's sidekick.
Evidence 9

Evidence 14

Evidence 15

Testimony 0
Testimony: I suppose I could have lifted something the size of that bust.
Person: Acro
Testimony 1
Testimony: I have a strong upper body from working as an acrobat, and only my legs were injured.
Person: Acro
Testimony 2
Testimony: However, lifting the bust and looking out of the window would've been impossible.
Person: Acro
Testimony 3
Testimony: There's no way I could have exerted that kind of force on my lower body.
Person: Acro
Testimony 4
Testimony: That makes it impossible for me to have known the location of the Ringmaster's head.
Person: Acro
Testimony 5
Testimony: Thus it would be unrealistic to drop the bust on him. Don't you think?
Person: Acro

Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
The head of Tender Lender loan company.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I ain't no liar. I never met Glen Elg.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: There was some lame guy with that name, though. Wanted to borrow cash from me.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: I set up a meetin' with the guy... at my office, Tender Lender.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I waited around for him, but he ain't ever showed.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: I ain't never been to that Tres Bien joint, youse hear?
Person: Tigre

Name: Lamiroir
Description: Singer lauded as the "Siren of the Ballad", from the tiny country of Borginia.
Character 5
Name: Machi Tobaye
Description: Lamiroir's favorite pianist. He is blind.

Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.

Description: Guitarist for the Gavinners. His day job is as a detective in Criminal Affairs, Div. 3.

Description: Famous magician, often on TV. Fond of exaggeration.

Description: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.

Description: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.

Description: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar... Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.

Evidence 7
Name: Mixing Board
Description: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.
Evidence 8

Name: Crime Photo

Evidence 10
Name: Diagram
Description: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. [caption] Observing from the door, the victim was blocked from sight by items. There was a gun next to the victim's body. Two bullet holes were found on the wall where the door was.
Evidence 11
Name: Video Tape
Description: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.
Evidence 12
Name: Headset
Description: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.

Description: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution. Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.
Evidence 14

Description: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.

Description: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.
Evidence 17

Evidence 18

Evidence 19

Description: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".
Evidence 20
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?

Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She apparently studied psychology while she was in Europe!

Description: The caretaker of Kyubi Manor. He says he was guarding the entrance at the time of the murder.

Name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
Description: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.

Name: Crime Scene Diagram

Description: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.

Description: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle. The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Description: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.

Description: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets. The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.

Description: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

Description: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at the agency. She's been arrested as the suspect in the case.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Currently working on his own. He says he wants to bring his friend's killer to justice, but I wonder if that's all.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of Apollo's.
Character 4
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. I defended her when she was on trial for the courtroom bombing incident.
Character 5
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case.[1] He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 6
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: Convicted of the murder at the Space Center seven years ago. He's chasing a phantom he saw back then.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 8
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 9
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 10
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 11
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 12
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Character 13
Name: Metis Cykes
Description: Athena's mother and victim of the murder seven years ago. She was a talented psychologist like her daughter.
Character 14
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 15
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The chief prosecutor. He's an old friend and a former prosecutor against whom I fought many courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 2
Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.
Evidence 5
Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.
Evidence 6
Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.
Evidence 7
Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.
Evidence 9
Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.
Evidence 11
Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.
Evidence 12
Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.

Description: My boss. He's taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.

Name: Bonny → Bonny de Famme
Description: A bunny-themed assistant who appeared onstage with Trucy.

Name: Mr. Retinz → Roger Retinz
Description: A man somehow connected to the magic show. He showed up at the theater after the incident took place.

Name: The Great Mr. Reus
Description: The victim in this case. A magician who took the stage with Trucy.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensic investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 7
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."

Name: Betty de Famme
Description: A magician who performed with Trucy. She is actually Bonny's twin sister.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.
Evidence 3
Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.
Evidence 4
Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.
Evidence 5
Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.
Evidence 6
Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.
Evidence 7
Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 8
Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.
Evidence 9
Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.
Evidence 10
Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.
Evidence 11
Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.
Evidence 12
Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.
Evidence 13
Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.
Evidence 14
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.
Evidence 15
Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.
Evidence 16
Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3
Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Person: Nahyuta

Testimony: It was I who murdered Justice Minister Inga.

Person: Nahyuta

Testimony: My mother was simply covering for me. I am ashamed I let her go so far for my sake.
Person: Nahyuta

Person: Nahyuta
